01About Me

Why I Want to Become a Front End Developer?

I was always interested in communication between people, especially in languages. But over the years I have also become more and more fascinated by both visual and electronic means of communication.

Everything started on a Python course at my previous job. Since that time I have been learning how to code and it is just over a year now. I attended two very short programming courses, but I am mostly a self-taught developer.

Currently I am looking for a job as Junior Front End Developer.

02Projects

Minimal Portfolio

It is my first project which I am not (very) ashamed to show to others. It is built in HTML5, CSS and pure Javascript. After a few months I rewrote it a bit in a more semantic way. I also organized CSS files according to SMACCS methodology then. This project really taught me what messy code means and why maintenance is important.

See this app View the code /

Pure JS Clocks with Neon Glow Effect

The aim of this project was to get more familiar with Date object and some CSS3 properties such as box-shadow, text-shadow, border-radius, animations and CSS variables. I also wanted to use any other Web Fonts that Google Fonts to practise using @font-face.

See this app View the code /

Classic To Do List

I have read recently that every time you build a to-do list app, a puppy üêï dies üò¢ . Even though I agree that the idea is definitely not cutting-edge, I have learned a lot by doing this project about the DOM, events, Local Storage, CSS gradients, how to create user interaction and how to use basic Sass features. The project was designed according to mobile first approach.

See this app View the code /

Currency Conventer

A simple currency converter with a custom dropdown list with icons. The converter calculates values based on the current currency exchange rates published by the National Bank of Poland. The data are retrieved by Fetch API.

See this app View the code /
